result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Michalek

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Michael J Michalek in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Vivien TenHaken.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Michael J Michalek. Called @ 1:34 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing on all files - 21CF539, 22CF11, and 21CT520. Record by Atty. Frost as to agreement of the parties. Victim is present in Court and makes a statement.
Record by the Court as to the victim's statement, and since victim is requesting something other than the joint agreement, he cannot hear this matter due to conflict. Court goes off the record to see if Judge Johnson is available to take this.
1:43 p.m. - COURT BACK IN SESSION WITH JUDGE JOHNSON PRESIDING. Atty. Frost restates the agreement of the parties to the Court. Record by the State who asks that restitution be held open for thirty (30) days. Victim recites her statement and request as to sentence to Judge Johnson. 
1:50 p.m. - Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant, who responds to Court's questions. Atty. Responds to Court's questions regarding plea, stipulation to prior convictions, and factual basis. 
Defendant enters following pleas:

GUILTY to Counts #1 and #5 in file 21CF539 - remaining counts dismissed and read-in.
GUILTY to Count #1 in file 21CT520 - remaining counts dismissed and read-in.
File 22CF11 is dismissed and read-in 

Court finds pleas to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent, finds defendant guilty, and asks if he wishes to make a statement. Defendant declines to make statement to the Court.
State has no further statement as to sentencing.
Record by Atty. Frost as to sentence
Response/record by the Court who adopts the agreement of the parties in its entirety.  Court finds defendant eligible for SAP if his probation is revoked. 
**SEE ATTAHCED PLEA AGREEMENT**

Parties have nothing further. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael J Michalek in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty. Crawford.  Attorney Melissa Anne Frost in court for Michael J Michalek. Called @ 2:14 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing on files - 21CF539, 22CF11, and 21CT520, but Atty. Frost asks that matter be set out, and makes a record as to reasons. Court grants the request and resets plea and sentencing. Atty. Keizer will be appearing in person for Atty. Frost, who is granted permission to appear by phone for the hearing. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Michael J Michalek appeared in court, Attorney Melissa Anne Frost for Michael J Michalek appeared in court, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by DA Zeke Wiedenfeld. Called @ 2:12 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status hearing on all files - 21CF539, 21CT520, and 22CF11. Record by Atty. Frost who asks for plea and sentencing date. Court sets all files as requested. Court in recess.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael J Michalek appeared in court, Attorney Melissa Anne Frost appeared in court for Michael J Michalek. Motion to modify bond by attorney Melissa Frost granted. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Michael J Michalek in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:26 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for adjourned initial appearance on file 22CF11, and status conference on 21CF539 & 21CT520. Record by Atty. Frost that they are willing to waive the preliminary hearing on 22CF11, but needs to go over the waiver form with the defendant. Court takes short recess for her to complete form with her client.
1:28 pm. - Court back in session with same appearances. Court goes over waiver of preliminary hearing with the defendant who responds to his questions. Court finds waiver to be knowing, voluntary, and intelligent. 
1:33 p.m. - Information is prepared - Record by Atty. Frost who enters not guilty pleas on behalf of her client. Court sets out all matters for status.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michael J Michalek in court with attorney Melissa Anne Frost.  Vivien L. TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant in court with attorney Melissa Frost. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not yet filed complaint. ADA Herrmann responds to courts questions. Minutes filed.

*AMENDMENT 2/23/2022 - MAY HAVE INCIDENTAL CONTACT AT FAMILY FUNCTIONS AND CONTACT FOR LEGAL PROCEEDING IN THE DIVORCE CASE*

TOTAL BOND COVERS 21GF1189 & 21CF539
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.M. OR HER RESIDENCE.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
